column4: hello. i have a netbook running ubuntu server and i'd like to give it a bigger disk. since it only fits 1 disk at a time, how do i go about it, using an external usb box under windows?
can i just use something like ghost to move everything over and then resize partitions later?
boot from usb live image, dd the contents of the old drive to the new drive, replace old drive, boot off of it, then you can create new partitions of something.
nice, i was worried something would explode if i did that
